0.title: Security increased in Punjab's Mohali ahead of PM's visit on Aug 24
0.article_body: Punjab Police have increased security in Mohali in the wake of PM Narendra Modi’s visit on August 24. PM Modi will inaugurate the Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre at Mohali's Mullanpur. During PM Modi's visit to Punjab in January this year, his convoy was disrupted and he was stuck on a flyover near Ferozepur for over 15 minutes.

1.title: My best results come when I'm smiling, having fun: US Open champion Raducanu
1.article_body: Talking about the advice she would like to give her younger self ahead of US Open 2022, 19-year-old Emma Raducanu said, "I'd say to have fun because it just makes what you're doing so enjoyable." She added, "My best results come when I'm smiling, enjoying it and having fun." Raducanu won the women's singles title at US Open last year.

2.title: Ukraine's football league to restart, all stadiums to have bomb shelters
2.article_body: Amid the war with Russia, Ukraine's football league is set to begin as Shakhtar Donetsk will play Metalist 1925 in Kharkiv on Tuesday. "This will be a unique competition: It will happen during a war, during military aggression, during bombardments," said Ukraine's football association head. All matches will be played near Kyiv and all stadiums will have a bomb shelter.

3.title: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan shares 1st post on Instagram since cruise drugs case
3.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan took to Instagram to share his first post since the cruise drugs case in which he was arrested last year. Sharing pictures with his brother AbRam and sister Suhana, he wrote, "Hat-trick." Shah Rukh commented on the post, writing, "Why I don’t have these pictures!!!!!! Give them to me NOW!"

4.title: China to start issuing visas to Indian students again after over 2 years
4.article_body: China has announced plans to issue visas for Indian students wishing to go back to study in China, after over two years of delay due to COVID-19 restrictions. The new relaxed visa rules will come into effect from August 24 onward, the Chinese embassy in India said. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar had earlier raised the issue with China.

5.title: Abhishek, Anees Bazmee attend Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala's funeral
5.article_body: Celebrities including Abhishek Bachchan, Anees Bazmee, Madhur Bhandarkar and Sajid Nadiadwala attended the funeral of late producer Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala, who passed away aged 91. He was known for producing films like 'Welcome', 'Hera Pheri' and 'Lahoo Ke Do Rang'. He died early Monday morning due to cardiac arrest at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai.

6.title: Man Utd-bound Casemiro breaks down as he bids farewell to Real Madrid
6.article_body: Brazilian midfielder Casemiro broke down as he bid farewell to La Liga club Real Madrid after being with them for nine years. "When I got here...my wife and I knew nobody...the greatest honour was to come here to work every day," said Casemiro. The player agreed a transfer to Manchester United in a deal reported to be worth £70 million.

7.title: Prabhas' next with Siddharth Anand to go on floors mid-2023: Reports
7.article_body: Prabhas is reportedly collaborating with director Siddharth Anand for his next action-thriller. As per reports, the film will go on floors in mid-2023 after Prabhas and Siddharth wrap their respective projects. The film, which reportedly will be produced by Mythri Movie Makers, is said to be a big budgeted project. It will be shot in India and abroad.

8.title: Prepared for everything now: Shehnaaz on life post Sidharth’s demise
8.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill said Sidharth Shukla's death has prepared her for everything to come. The actress said the grief she has experienced last year has made her "very strong" as a person. Addressing the trolling against her song 'Tu Yaheen Hai', which was released after Sidharth's death, Shehnaaz said it was her way to pay tribute to him before resuming work.

9.title: Used to find my right profile 'ugly', would ask photographers to not shoot: Vidya
9.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan on Instagram recalled the times when she would request filmmakers or photographers to not shoot her right profile as she found it "ugly". But with time, Vidya said she is "no longer scared" to flaunt all her sides. "What changed is the way I looked at myself and that changed how I see myself," she said.

10.title: Always wanted to do a Dharma film: Arjun Bijlani on ‘Rocky Aur Rani…’
10.article_body: Actor Arjun Bijlani will be seen in Karan Johar's film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. While the film stars him in a guest appearance, Arjun said he hopes "to do bigger things" under Dharma Productions. "From childhood...I wanted to do a Dharma film," he said, adding that being in the Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt-starrer was his "Dharma moment".

11.title: I think Shakib is going to re-energise Bangladesh: Shane Watson
11.article_body: After Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan was appointed as the skipper for the upcoming Asia Cup, former Australian cricketer Shane Watson said that the move is going to "re-energise" the team. "He's (Shakib) so experienced...His decision-making...under pressure is going to be invaluable," Watson said. He added that he will be "very surprised" if Shakib doesn't "dominate" the Asia Cup.

12.title: Shanghai United Imaging shares jump 75% after $1.6 bn IPO
12.article_body: Pharmaceutical company Shanghai United Imaging shares surged 75% to 192.48 yuan on the first day of trading after its $1.6 billion Initial Public Offering (IPO). The company raised 10.99 billion yuan in its IPO which was more than 3,500 times oversubscribed among retail investors. This is seventh Chinese listing this year that has an offering of more than $1 billion.

13.title: Police lathicharge Raj students gathered for student election rally
13.article_body: Police on Monday lathicharged students, who had allegedly gathered without permission on university and college campuses in several cities in Rajasthan, during filing of nominations for the students' union elections. Narendra Yadav, ABVP candidate for the President's post in Jaipur's Rajasthan University, held a show of strength with a large number of his supporters during nomination, police said.

14.title: 'Brahmastra 2' to feature Deepika-Ranveer with Alia-Ranbir: Reports
14.article_body: Ahead of Brahmastra Part One's release, rumours are suggesting that the sequel of the Ayan Mukerji trilogy will feature Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh in pivotal roles. As per reports, Deepika-Ranveer's story will run parallel to Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's story in 'Brahmastra 2'. The trilogy will reportedly be interlinked with many actors featuring in cameos.

15.title: I think it's great, you get used to each other: Alia on live-in relationships
15.article_body: Alia Bhatt during a recent interview opened up about the concept of live-in relationships, saying, "If you can, why not? I think it's great." "You get used to each other, you get comfortable, you build so many memories without the pressure and that baggage or like 'shaadi karni hai (we want to get married)'. To each his own," Alia added.

16.title: Skye Air to focus on long range delivery of medicines in Kolkata
16.article_body: Drone startup Skye Air Mobility in partnership with Flipkart Health+ will be taking up long range deliveries of medicines at a distance of 60-70 km in Kolkata and suburban areas as part of its ongoing trials. So far, Skye Mobility was delivering medicines at a maximum distance of 16 km. The trials will go on till September 8, 2022.

17.title: Odisha govt must check atrocities on Dalits and tribals: Athawale
17.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale has urged the Odisha government to "take steps to check atrocities" on Dalits and tribals in the state. Addressing a press conference in Bhubaneswar, Athawale said that Odisha recorded 2,828 cases of crime against Dalits and tribals in 2020-21. He added that there was a need to encourage inter-caste marriages to end discrimination.

18.title: Adidas CEO Kasper Rorsted to step down in 2023
18.article_body: Adidas announced that its CEO Kasper Rorsted will be stepping down next year. Rorsted, who led Adidas since 2016, will remain in the position till his successor is found, Adidas said. His contract was renewed for five years in 2020. "Enabling a restart in 2023 is the right thing to do, both for the company and me personally," Rorsted said.

19.title: Cong 'unanimously' in Rahul's favour for party President post: Raj CM
19.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said the party is "unanimously" in favour of Rahul Gandhi becoming the next Congress President. "If Rahul Gandhi does not become the party President, it will be a disappointment for Congress supporters in the country. Many people will sit at home and we will suffer," CM Gehlot said.

20.title: Nearly 9,000 personnel lost in war with Russia: Ukrainian general
20.article_body: General Valeriy Zaluzhnyi, chief of Ukrainian armed forces, on Monday said Ukraine has lost nearly 9,000 military personnel in the ongoing war with Russia. Zaluzhnyi did not specify if the figure included all service personnel killed in action, such as border guards. Notably, Ukraine on Sunday claimed that 45,000 Russian military personnel had been killed in the conflict thus far.

21.title: Binged 'Game of Thrones' in 2 weeks: House of the Dragon's Milly Alcock
21.article_body: 'House of the Dragon' actress Milly Alcock said she "binged" all eight seasons of 'Game of Thrones' in two weeks to prepare herself for its prequel. She said she found it "intense" and understood why everyone loved it. Alcock said she was in "shock and disbelief" to find out that she will play Rhaenyra Targaryen in the show.

22.title: Not doing it due to agreement issues: Krushna on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'
22.article_body: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' (TKSS), which is returning with its new season, will not feature Krushna Abhishek. The actor confirmed the news and said, "Not doing it. Agreement issues." The upcoming season of the Kapil Sharma-hosted show will introduce the audience to some new artistes. The makers will soon officially announce the show's premiere date.

23.title: BCB President Nazmul Hassan keeps me under pressure: Shakib Al Hasan
23.article_body: Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan said that BCB President Nazmul Hassan keeps him "under pressure". "So there is some chance of pressure being there. Since it's a challenging position and the board felt that I was the best option available, maybe that's why they chose me," Shakib said. The all-rounder has been appointed as the skipper for the Asia Cup.

24.title: How much prize money did Praggnanandhaa win from event in which he defeated Carlsen?
24.article_body: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the FTX Crypto Cup. Praggnanandhaa also defeated world number four Alireza Firouzja, world number nine Anish Giri and world number six Levon Aronian in the tournament. Praggnanandhaa bagged a total prize money of $37,500 in the event after finishing runner-up. Champion Magnus Carlsen won $40,000.

25.title: I believe in coming back to drawing board when things don't go my way: Iyer
25.article_body: All-rounder Venkatesh Iyer, who hasn't played for India since February 2022, said he always believes in coming back to the drawing board and working on his basics when things don't go his way. "I'm working on my fitness and...bowling so that I can add a few clicks to my pace...You need to keep on upgrading yourself," he added.

26.title: 'Sab golmaal hai': BJP shares parody video of Kejriwal
26.article_body: The BJP recently shared a parody video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and titled it "Golmaal hai bhai sab golmaal hai". The video implies that CM Kejriwal is directly behind corruption in the national capital. The video comes amid a political battle between BJP and AAP over Manish Sisodia's role in the excise policy scam.

27.title: Drunk woman abuses & manhandles auto driver alleging harassment on MP road, video out
27.article_body: A video has shown a woman, who was reportedly drunk, abusing and manhandling an auto driver on a busy road in MP's Gwalior. The woman reportedly got down from the scooter she was riding and started abusing the driver, alleging harassment and eve-teasing on Sunday. She didn't stop even after police were called to the spot.

28.title: Paytm shares jump over 3% after reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma
28.article_body: The share price of the parent company of Paytm, One 97 Communications, rose over 3% after the reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as the company's Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Managing Director (MD). 99.67% shareholders of the company voted in favour of the reappointment at company's annual general meeting on August 21. The stock has lost 41.2% in 2022.

29.title: Saudi BNPL platform Tamara raises $100 mn in Series B round
29.article_body: Saudi Arabian buy now, pay later (BNPL) platform, Tamara, has raised $100 million in a Series B funding round. The round was led by Sanabil Investments, which is owned by Saudi Arabia's sovereign fund. Founded in 2020 by Saudi entrepreneurs Abdulmajeed Alsukhan, Turki Bin Zarah and Abdulmohsen Albabtain, Tamara has partnered with companies such as IKEA, SHEIN and Namshi.

30.title: India create record for most ODI series whitewashes in 2022, defeat Zimbabwe 3-0
30.article_body: India defeated Zimbabwe by 13 runs in the third ODI in Harare to complete a 3-0 series whitewash. With this, India created the record for most ODI series whitewashes in 2022 with 3 clean sweeps. India had earlier completed two ODI series whitewashes against West Indies. New Zealand, Pakistan and Afghanistan have registered two ODI series whitewashes each this year.

31.title: Jacqueline makes 1st public appearance since being named accused in extortion case
31.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez was spotted in Mumbai on Monday for the first time since she was named as an accused in an extortion case. Last week, Jacqueline was named in the chargesheet filed by the ED in the ₹200-crore extortion case connected to conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. On Monday, Jacqueline was seen at a temple paying her respects.

32.title: At least 20 dead due to flash floods in Afghanistan
32.article_body: Flash floods have killed at least 20 people in the Logar province of Afghanistan over the last 48 hours, the country's disaster management authority said on Monday. Another 35 people have been injured due to the flooding, officials added. Notably, more than 1,000 people were killed in a massive earthquake that hit the country in June this year.

33.title: Indian YouTubers tweet 'chess is the new cricket'; world number 1 Carlsen reacts
33.article_body: After India's R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number 1 chess player Magnus Carlsen, Indian YouTubers, Abhi and Niyu, tweeted, "Chess is the new cricket. Prove me wrong!" Carlsen reacted to the tweet, listing reasons "why chess isn't cricket", and said, "Cricket is played on a field...chess is played on a board...Cricket has bat and ball, chess...doesn't...I can't play cricket."

34.title: 12 people missing in U'khand amid heavy rain; sniffer dogs deployed
34.article_body: The Uttarakhand State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) on Monday deployed four sniffer dogs in Sarkhet village to trace 12 people, who are feared trapped under debris for over 48 hours, SDRF Commandant Manikant Mishra said. Torrential rainfall had caused severe damage to properties in Dehradun and Tehri Garhwal districts, the official added. Sarkhet was struck by a cloudburst on Saturday.

35.title: Indians Srikanth, Prannoy reach 2nd round at World Championships 2022
35.article_body: India's Kidambi Srikanth defeated Nhat Nguyen of Ireland 22-20, 21-19 to enter the men's singles second round at Badminton World Championships 2022 in Tokyo on Monday. The 2021 silver medallist won the match in 51 minutes. Unseeded Indian HS Prannoy defeated Luka Wraber of Austria 21-12, 21-11. In the men's doubles, MR Arjun and Dhruv Kapila entered the second round.

36.title: Mamata announces 11-day Puja holidays, ₹60,000 grant for Puja clubs
36.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday announced government holidays for Durga Puja from September 30 to October 10. She also added that the Puja committees will get financial assistance of ₹60,000, an increase of ₹10,000 from last year. "We will also provide them a rebate of 60% on the electricity bill," Banerjee added.

37.title: Sidharth & Kiara in talks for Shashank Khaitan's rom-com film: Report
37.article_body: Actors Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani, who are rumoured to be dating each other, are reportedly in talks for a rom-com film which will be directed by Shashank Khaitan. The upcoming film will go on the floors by the end of this year, the report said. It will be produced by Karan Johar's Dharma Productions, the report further said.

38.title: 3 bathing in rivers drown in Nainital in 2 incidents; 1 missing
38.article_body: Three persons, including two teenagers, who went into rivers for a bath drowned in two separate incidents in Uttarakhand's Nainital in the last 24 hours, police said on Monday, adding that a fourth person is still missing. In one of the incidents, some children raised an alarm after spotting the two teenagers being washed away due to strong water currents.

39.title: Beating Nadal in middle of tournament felt great: Cincinnati Open champ Coric
39.article_body: Asked about his thoughts on winning match after match at Cincinnati Open 2022, including one against Rafael Nadal, champion Borna Coric said he felt great after beating the 22-time Grand Slam champion in middle of the tournament. "I was just believing that I can win the next match. That's what I did for five days in a row," he added.

40.title: Pique among Barca players not happy with Dembele's new contract: Reports
40.article_body: Barcelona players Gerard Pique, Sergio Busquets, and Jordi Alba are reportedly not happy after details of winger Ousmane Dembele's new contract came to light. The three senior players have taken salary cuts over the last two years to help the team register new players. Meanwhile, leaks suggest Dembele has clauses in his contract which could see him earn £20 million/season.

41.title: Kejriwal is a 'big liar', his Ministers are 'bigger' liars: BJP
41.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Monday called Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal a "big liar" and his Ministers "bigger liars". His remark came following Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's claim that BJP offered him the CM's post if he broke AAP. Kejriwal's model of governance has shifted from "mohalla clinics" to "mohalla thekas", Thakur added.

42.title: 4 killed, 11 injured as truck rams into SUV carrying students in MP
42.article_body: Four students died and 11 others sustained injuries after a speeding truck rammed into an SUV carrying 15 school students in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Monday, police said. Eyewitnesses said an ambulance reached the spot 15 minutes after the incident and passersby took the students to a hospital in a passenger bus. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has condoled the deaths.

43.title: Runner-up Odinga challenges Kenya's Prez poll result in top court
43.article_body: Raila Odinga, runner-up of Kenyan presidential polls, on Monday challenged the election results in the Supreme Court. In his petition, Odinga sought nullification of the vote's outcome. He argued that there was a mismatch between the turnout figures and the result. He further contended that the election commission had failed to tally ballots from 27 constituencies as required by law.

44.title: Tired of my 'dabang' reputation, it gets me into trouble unnecessarily: Swara
44.article_body: Swara Bhasker, who'll be seen alongside Shikha Talsania, Meher Vij and Pooja Chopra in 'Jahaan Chaar Yaar', has said she asked the film's writer-director Kamal Pandey to give her the "most shy" character in the film. "I told him...I'm tired of this 'dabang' reputation of mine. I'm fed up of this reputation, which gets me into trouble unnecessarily," Swara added.

45.title: Women share videos of themselves partying in Finland after PM Sanna criticised
45.article_body: Women in Finland are sharing videos of themselves dancing and partying to show support for PM Sanna Marin who was criticised after a video of her partying with her friends went viral. The women are sharing the video with the hashtag 'Solidarity with Sanna' on Twitter. Marin was accused of taking drugs after the video went viral.

46.title: 4-yr-old Gurugram girl gets raped after being lured with toffees
46.article_body: A four-year-old girl was allegedly molested and forced to have oral sex with a 23-year-old man in Gurugram. The accused, Sahil alias Nitu, allegedly took the girl to his home after enticing her with toffees, the victim's mother wrote in her complaint. She further alleged that Sahil often molested the minor. The accused has been arrested under the POCSO Act.

47.title: Rajinikanth's first look from 'Jailer' revealed, film goes on floors
47.article_body: The makers of 'Jailer' shared actor Rajinikanth's first look from the Nelson Dilipkumar directorial on Twitter. They also shared that the film went on the floors in Chennai on Monday. The film, which also stars Tamannaah Bhatia and Sanjay Dutt in pivotal roles, marks Rajinikanth's first collaboration with Nelson. It will reportedly be shot entirely on a prison set.

48.title: Heavy rains cause flood-like situation in Kota; schools closed
48.article_body: Heavy rainfall in the last 24 hours has caused a flood-like situation in parts of Rajasthan's Kota and nearby areas like Bundi, Baran, Jhalawar and Tonk. The Kota district administration said that nearly 1,500 people from different parts of the district have been moved and sent to safer places. Schools in the district have also been closed till further orders.

49.title: India's Deepak Chahar 'mankads' Zimbabwe opener, doesn't appeal; video goes viral
49.article_body: A video has gone viral showing India fast bowler Deepak Chahar 'mankading' Zimbabwe opener Innocent Kaia at the start of Zimbabwe's innings in the third ODI in Harare. Chahar removed the bails in his run-up while Innocent was outside his crease. However, Chahar did not appeal and was seen having a word with Innocent, seemingly giving him a warning.

50.title: Hindi films need course correction: Manoj Bajpayee
50.article_body: Commenting on Bollywood's "bad phase" at the box office, actor Manoj Bajpayee said the Hindi film industry needs "course correction". Stating that "Hindi cinema will not die", the actor said, "It will course-correct and come back to its normal self" and will witness a "new exciting phase". His comment came after 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' failed to perform.

51.title: Bollywood has been painted as a dark place after Sushant's death: Swara
51.article_body: Swara Bhasker has spoken about the social media trends demanding boycott of Bollywood films. She claimed the current trend is to spew hate toward Bollywood which gained momentum post Sushant Singh Rajput's demise. "After unfortunate...suicide of Sushant, Bollywood has been painted as a dark place, that is only about drug, alcohol and sex...Unfortunately, Bollywood is being discredited," she said.

52.title: Several hurt as JNU students, staff clash over scholarships; video surfaces
52.article_body: Clashes broke out on the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus in Delhi on Monday between students, led by the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP), and staff members over scholarship funds. The ABVP has claimed the administration "attacked students for asking for their rightful fellowships". "Many students have been seriously injured," ABVP tweeted, while sharing a video of the incident.

53.title: 3 people, including father and son, killed with spade in Jharkhand
53.article_body: Three people, including a father and his son, were allegedly killed by a relative in Chandidih village in Jharkhand's Khunti district. The accused, Hemant Purty, allegedly used a spade in killing them and was intoxicated while committing the crime, police said. The deceased have been identified as Bitna Munda (65), Suda Munda (25) and Vikas Mahto.

54.title: Girls, boys sitting together in classroom won't lead to gender equality: Cong
54.article_body: Senior Congress leader K Muraleedharan on Sunday said making girls and boys sit together in the classroom will not lead to gender equality. "Not everyone would welcome it. It is not just the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) which is against it. A lot of people in Kerala have not accepted that concept. It is unnecessary," he said.

55.title: She was an icon: Adnan Sami mourns demise of Pak singer Nayyara Noor
55.article_body: Singer Adnan Sami took to Twitter to share a post mourning the demise of Pakistani singer Nayyara Noor. "Just learned the sad news that legendary singer Nayyara Noor Sahiba has passed away. She was an icon and her contribution to music will be remembered and loved forever," he wrote. Nayyara passed away on Sunday at the age of 71.

56.title: 1 booked after Hanuman idol vandalised in Delhi's Mahendra Park
56.article_body: A case has been registered against a person for allegedly vandalising a Hanuman idol at a small temple in northwest Delhi's Mahendra Park area, police said. A video showing a man with a rod near the temple was reportedly accessed by locals. Police suspect that the accused vandalised the idol in a drunken stupor. He is yet to be arrested.

57.title: India Women are also as talented as other teams: Batter Yastika Bhatia
57.article_body: Speaking about India Women's mindset against England Women in semi-final at CWG 2022, India Women batter Yastika Bhatia said her side had certain plans against certain batters and bowlers and had practised accordingly. "It was all about executing that well on...ground. We're also as talented as other teams...it was all about holding our nerves in crunch situations," she added.

58.title: Supreme Court agrees to hear review petition of PMLA judgement
58.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to list a review petition against its earlier judgement which upheld the constitutional validity of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. When the plea was mentioned, a bench headed by Chief Justice NV Ramana said, "Okay, we will list it." Following the previous verdict, various Opposition parties expressed their apprehension over its 'long-term implications'.

59.title: Maharashtra govt to pay fees of college students who lost both parents to COVID-19
59.article_body: The Maharashtra government will bear the education cost of college students who've lost both their parents to COVID-19, state Minister Chandrakant Patil said. "As many as 931 undergraduate and 228 postgraduate students of various government colleges have lost both their parents to COVID-19," Patil announced in the state Assembly. This will cost the state exchequer over ₹2 crore annually.

60.title: Man throws egg at Ganpati procession in Mumbai; arrested
60.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly throwing an egg at a Ganpati procession in Mumbai's Kamathipura area on Sunday. A crowd gathered at the spot soon after the incident took place. The police said that there was no communal issue in the area and the matter was resolved immediately.

61.title: 50 'bee hotels' installed in B'luru, bee population being sampled
61.article_body: Scientists at Ashoka Trust for Research in Ecology and the Environment (ATREE) have placed 50 "bee hotels" across Bengaluru to integrate bees into urban spaces and encourage conservation efforts. The scientists have begun sampling the city's bee population. The decline in bee population due to human interference could not be ascertained earlier as sampling has never been carried out before.

62.title: Director N Lingusamy, his brother sentenced to 6 months in jail in cheque fraud case
62.article_body: 'The Warriorr' director N Lingusamy and his brother N Subash Chandra Bose have been sentenced to six months in jail in a cheque fraud case. The case was filed against the brothers by a production company after they didn't repay over ₹1 crore they had taken from them. The brothers had given a cheque to the production company, which bounced.

63.title: Friends insert steel glass inside man at a party in Gujarat, pic of X-ray surfaces
63.article_body: A man's friends inserted a steel glass inside him through his rectum during a party in Gujarat's Surat. The man, who hails from Odisha, was in a drunken state when the incident happened. He returned to Odisha and got it surgically removed after 10 days at Brahmapur's MKCG Medical College And Hospital. A picture of his X-ray has surfaced online.

64.title: Job aspirant holding Tricolour thrashed and caned by Patna ADM in public, video surfaces
64.article_body: A video of Patna ADM KK Singh beating up and caning a job aspirant in public has surfaced online. In the video, the aspiring teacher can be seen holding the National Flag and lying on the road. KK Singh can be seen thrashing him with a stick and caning him. The job aspirant has been admitted to a hospital.

65.title: Sequoia’s Surge selects 15 Indian, SEA startups for its 7th cohort
65.article_body: Sequoia India and Sequoia Southeast Asia's rapid scale-up programme Surge launched its seventh cohort of 15 startups and has invested a total of $41 million. The startups in this cohort are mostly focused on software and deep-tech firms and there is no investment in edtech or Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) segments. According to a statement, Surge 07 is a 16-week hybrid programme.

66.title: 8-yr-old Delhi girl missing for 2 weeks found dead with her throat slit
66.article_body: The body of an eight-year-old girl, who was missing for two weeks, was found near Delhi's Yamuna Khadar area, police said on Sunday. The girl had gone missing on August 5, police said, adding that the girl was gagged and her throat slit. It is also suspected that a known person committed the crime, a police official said.

67.title: Evacuations ordered, schools shut over heavy rains in Odisha, MP
67.article_body: Heavy rains triggered massive floods and caused swelling of rivers in Odisha, due to which authorities evacuated 1.2 lakh people in Balasore and Mayurbhanj districts in two days. Meanwhile, in Madhya Pradesh, many parts witnessed heavy rainfall, resulting in closure of schools. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said that Bay of Bengal will witness a deep depression from August 23.

68.title: You seriously deserved that: Yuvraj to Shubman on his 1st international ton
68.article_body: Congratulating India opener Shubman Gill on his maiden international century against Zimbabwe in the third ODI, Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter and wrote, "Finally!!! Well played Shubman, you seriously deserved that ton!" He added, "Many more to come, this is just a start." The 22-year-old scored 130 runs in 97 balls in Harare today.

69.title: PM Modi will lose in 2024 if he doesn't file affidavit in Ram Setu case: Swamy
69.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy has commented on the ongoing Supreme Court case where he seeks for “Ram Setu” to be granted the status of national heritage. “The [Supreme Court]...directed to Govt to file a yes no affidavit. If yes, then [it’s] my victory. If no, then it [is PM Narendra] Modi’s defeat in 2024 [Lok Sabha polls],” Swamy tweeted.

70.title: 4 dead, 2 lose eyesight after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar
70.article_body: Four people died, while two others lost eyesight after allegedly consuming poisonous liquor at two villages in Bihar's Rohtas. Those who died include a 72-year-old retired circle inspector. Officials were camping in the area and conducting raids against the liquor mafia. A police officer said 12 mafia members were arrested and 212 litres of liquor was seized in two days.

71.title: Bihar staring at worst-ever drought in last 5 decades: state Agriculture Minister
71.article_body: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh said with 40% deficient rains and paddy sowing being hit, Bihar is staring at perhaps the "worst-ever drought in the last five decades". The Indian Express quoted him as saying, "CM Nitish Kumar and I have been moving in the field to make the assessment on the ground and are finding the situation very alarming."

72.title: 'Delhi model' is to give honesty certificates to corrupts: Thakur
72.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur questioned Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal’s silence over corruption charges against his deputy and asserted that Kejriwal's Delhi model is to award honesty certificates to dishonest ministers. “Kejriwal model decoded. You spend hundreds of crores of rupees to do publicity with no accountability. And when you get caught, you fix the liability on someone else,” said Thakur.

73.title: Won't accept inclusion of non-locals, would end J&K's identity: Abdullah
73.article_body: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah on Monday said the "inclusion of non-local voters" in the electoral rolls of J&K was not acceptable to the parties and that it would end the union territory's identity. "The Assembly will be in the hands of the outsiders and the people here will be denied," Abdullah said.

74.title: I'm seeking justice, man who said he loved her maligning her image: Jiah's mother
74.article_body: Late actress Jiah Khan's mother Rabia stated that she is like any mother seeking justice for her daughter. "The man who claimed to love her is maligning her image...The accused is hiding," she said. Jiah committed suicide in 2013 and blamed her former partner Sooraj Pancholi in her suicide note. Rabia has testified that Sooraj verbally and physically abused Jiah.

75.title: Form is temporary, class is permanent: De Villiers on Kohli ahead of Asia Cup
75.article_body: Ex-SA wicketkeeper-batter AB De Villiers has said Virat Kohli doesn't need anyone to tell him to work hard to come out of his poor form. "Form is temporary, class is permanent...Virat and I remain in regular contact. We're friends, and he certainly doesn't need me to tell him the importance of working hard during a bad patch," stated De Villiers.

76.title: Sisodia deserves Bharat Ratna instead CBI raid conducted against him: Kejriwal
76.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said his deputy Manish Sisodia deserves the "Bharat Ratna". "He (Manish Sisodia) reformed government schools which other parties could not do in 70 years. Such a person should get Bharat Ratna," Kejriwal added. "The entire country's education system should be handed over to him but instead, they conducted CBI raid against him," he stated.

77.title: Pune Rural Police arrest man for raping 16-year-old
77.article_body: A man was arrested by the Pune Rural Police for raping a 16-year-old girl, after her mother lodged a First Information Report (FIR), officials said. The accused, aged 25, was booked on rape charges under the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Prevention of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. The police also added that the accused and victim are neighbours.

78.title: Assailants on a bike shoot 27-yr-old man in broad daylight in Pune
78.article_body: Two motorcycle-borne assailants shot down a 27-year-old conservancy truck worker in broad daylight, in Pune city's Chandan Nagar area, the police said. The deceased, identified as Akshay Prakash Bhise, was killed while he was on his way to work. Police officials said that efforts are on to arrest the accused, and the area's CCTV footage is being checked for clues.

79.title: She was harassed, didn't imagine this: Dad of UP woman who's body was found
79.article_body: Days after the body of a 25-year old woman was found on a railway track in Uttar Pradesh, the father of the deceased said that she was being harassed for dowry after her wedding. "We tried to settle the issue...we had not imagined that they would kill her by throwing her before a moving train," he said.

80.title: Largest shipment of fentanyl seized in Australia; 5 million doses recovered
80.article_body: Australian Federal Police (AFP) in a joint operation with Australian Border Force (ABF) have seized the largest shipment of fentanyl ever detected in the country and recovered over five million doses of the opioid, ABF said in a statement on Monday. Over 11 kg of pure fentanyl and about 30 kg of methamphetamine were hidden in the shipment, it added.

81.title: Standup comedians, Hyd-linked traders being probed in Delhi liquor scam: Report
81.article_body: Standup comedians, Hyderabad-linked wholesale and retail traders and corporate entities sharing similar Mumbai addresses are being probed in alleged Delhi liquor licensing scam, reports quoted officials as saying. CBI, after conducting searches in locations including Mumbai, Delhi and Hyderabad, filed FIR against 15 people, two companies and "other unknown public servants and private persons".

82.title: Workers in Argentina hold 'funeral' for their wages, pics surface
82.article_body: Several workers in Argentina held a protest demanding government action to boost salaries and unemployment benefits amid higher inflation. They held a symbolic funeral for their wages. "The paycheck has died," read a banner, while another placard read, "RIP the minimum wage". The country’s official monthly minimum wage stands at 45,540 Argentine pesos ($334).

83.title: I don't need to react: Sonam on being trolled for maternity photoshoot
83.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor has opened up about being trolled for her maternity photoshoot and said, "I think...one thing I've grown out of is reacting to things I don't need to react to." "I come from a place of extreme privilege and [I've]...nothing to complain about, so if someone is saying something...from behind a keyboard, [it's]...none of my business," she added.

84.title: I'm not 20, it won't take me anywhere: Meera on doing Kubbra's Sacred Games role
84.article_body: Actress Meera Chopra has stated that she would not be open to doing Kubbra Sait's role of a trans-woman in 'Sacred Games'. "I'm not 20 anymore, I'm not at the age where I would imagine that such a thing would take me somewhere," she said. The actress added that she has also refused offers over being asked to kiss onscreen.

85.title: CWG gold medallist Lakshya enters 2nd round at World Championships 2022
85.article_body: Commonwealth Games 2022 gold medal-winning shuttler Lakshya Sen entered the second round at World Championships 2022 after defeating HK Solberg Vittinghus of Denmark 21-12, 21-11 in Tokyo on Monday. Ninth-seeded Lakshya, who won a bronze medal in the last edition, ended the match in 35 minutes. Earlier, 2019 bronze medallist Sai Praneeth lost in the first round.

86.title: Are other castes of compromising nature?: Agnihotri on Sisodia's remarks
86.article_body: Film director Vivek Agnihotri criticised Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia for his "I am a Rajput" remark. Sharing Sisodia’s statement, he tweeted, "Does this mean had he not been a Rajput, he would have given in? So what about those people in Delhi who are Brahmins, Yadavs, Gujjars, Jats, Sikhs, etc? Are they all of a compromising nature?"

87.title: 1 arrested, 50 booked for assaulting police at concert venue in Kerala
87.article_body: One person has been arrested and 50 others have been booked for assaulting policemen after they shut down a concert at a Kerala beach on Sunday. Police said the venue could not accommodate all the attendees which created a disturbance and overcrowding. Six policemen and 30 members of the public were injured after the accused threw stones and beer bottles.

88.title: Shubman smashes highest-ever ODI score by an Indian in Zimbabwe, breaks Sachin's record
88.article_body: India's 22-year-old opener Shubman Gill on Monday smashed the highest-ever score in ODI cricket by an Indian in Zimbabwe. Shubman scored 130 runs off 97 deliveries, including 15 fours and a six, in the third ODI against Zimbabwe in Harare. The previous record was held by Sachin Tendulkar, who had smashed 127* runs off 130 deliveries in Bulawayo in 1998.

89.title: Blessing in disguise: Snapdeal CEO on old email saying his US visa was rejected
89.article_body: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl shared a 15-year-old email stating his application for H1-B visa in 2007 was rejected by the US government. "I returned to India and couldn't be more thankful that this happened to me," Bahl tweeted. Calling it a "blessing in disguise", he said he got the chance to start his own company, Snapdeal, in his own country.

90.title: Sikh girl abducted, raped and forcibly converted to Islam in Pakistan
90.article_body: A Sikh girl named Dina Kaur was abducted and forcibly converted to Islam on Saturday in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province of Pakistan, ANI reported. She was reported to be abducted on gunpoint, raped and married to her abductor with the help of local administration and police, ANI added. Sikh community in Buner blocked roads and organised massive protests after the incident.

91.title: Cricketers react as Shubman Gill smashes his 1st ODI ton
91.article_body: Reacting to Team India opener Shubman Gill's first-ever hundred in international cricket, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "First of many...for this youngster, well done." Veteran batter Robin Uthappa wrote, "Shubman played some gun shots with panache!! An absolute delight to watch." Shubman scored 130 off 97 deliveries as India posted 289/8 against Zimbabwe in the third ODI.

92.title: Former Pak PM Imran Khan gets protective bail in terrorism case
92.article_body: Islamabad High Court has granted former Pakistan PM Imran Khan protective bail till Thursday after he was booked under the anti-terror act for allegedly threatening two top police officials and a magistrate. This comes after Khan's lawyers filed a petition seeking pre-arrest bail. The petition stated that Khan was a "target of the ruling PDM (Pakistan Democratic Movement)", reported Dawn.

93.title: 'This is a good omen': Alia recalls Gadot's husband's reaction to her pregnancy
93.article_body: Alia Bhatt, who's expecting her first child with Ranbir Kapoor, spoke about how her 'Heart of Stone' co-star Gal Gadot and her husband Jaron Varsano reacted to her pregnancy. She said Gal had a "lovely reaction" while Jaron called it "a good omen". "Jaron was like, 'This is a good omen...everything's gonna go really well, it's lovely for...movie'," Alia said.

94.title: B'luru sees decline in daily COVID-19 caseload, logs 273 new cases
94.article_body: Bengaluru added 273 new cases to its COVID-19 tally with a positivity rate of 6.06% in the last 24 hours, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief informed on Sunday. The city had recorded as many as 965 cases on the previous day. According to data shared by the BBMP chief on Sunday, Bengaluru's active caseload stood at 7,251.

95.title: Request passengers to vote for AAP: Kejriwal to bus drivers in Gujarat
95.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal has asked bus drivers and conductors in Gujarat to request passengers to vote for AAP in the upcoming Assembly elections to bring a change. He also said, "We're guaranteeing that we'll provide free and best health treatment to all Gujaratis...Mohalla clinics and health clinics will be opened in cities and villages."

96.title: History-sheeter injured in encounter with Ghaziabad Police
96.article_body: Ghaziabad Police arrested a man wanted in multiple robbery and attempted murder cases on Sunday following an encounter. The accused tried escaping the site of a routine checking, police said. In the ensuing encounter, he was shot in the leg, as per police. It was revealed during investigation that he is a member of the Deepak Agrola gang, police added.

97.title: WI ruled 2 overs short of target in 3rd NZ ODI, players fined 40% of match fee
97.article_body: West Indies players have been fined 40% of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate against New Zealand in the third and final ODI. The sanctions were imposed by match referee Richie Richardson on the hosts, who lost the game by five wickets. With the win, New Zealand also won the three-match ODI series 2-1.

98.title: BJP's 'modus operandi' to topple govts is using central agencies: AAP's Atishi
98.article_body: AAP leader Atishi on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi and BJP’s "modus operandi" to topple governments is to use central agencies. "They first use these agencies...CBI, ED...to lodge cases against leaders (of Opposition parties)…BJP reaches those leaders and offers them to join…party with the promise to close all cases against them," Atishi added.

99.title: Andhra CM Jagan Mohan Reddy meets PM Narendra Modi in Delhi
99.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Mohan Reddy met PM Narendra Modi at his residence today in the national capital. This is his second meeting with the PM in the last three months. He is also expected to meet some of the Union Ministers. He met the PM earlier this year and discussed about many projects including Polavaram, Kadapa Steel Plant, etc.

100.title: Dehradun Police team leaves for Gurugram to arrest Bobby Kataria
100.article_body: A Dehradun Police team has left for Gurugram to arrest social media influencer Bobby Kataria for allegedly having liquor on a road by blocking traffic last month. The police will move court for confiscation of Kataria's property if he is not found, an official said. He added that two notices had already been issued to Kataria earlier this month.

101.title: Ease of doing drug business: Rahul to PM Modi on Guj drug hauls
101.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi on Monday over multiple drug busts from Gujarat and asked for how long he would be silent on the matter. "Drugs worth thousands of crores are reaching Gujarat. Who is spreading this poison in the holy land of Gandhi-Patel," Gandhi said in a tweet in Hindi.

102.title: Mobile phone charger explodes, catches fire in MP; 4-year-old boy injured
102.article_body: A mobile phone charger exploded in the hands of a 4-year-old boy and got stuck in his hand after he grabbed the phone which was charging in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur. The charger got stuck in the boy's fingers and caught fire after the explosion. The child is undergoing treatment and has suffered severe burn injuries on his hand.

103.title: Gunmen kidnapped 4 Catholic nuns on a highway in Nigeria: Convent
103.article_body: A local convent said on Monday that gunmen have kidnapped four Catholic nuns on a highway in Nigeria's Imo. The convent's secretary general said that the abducted nuns had been travelling from Rivers to Imo for a thanksgiving mass. Earlier in June, a lawmaker had said that at least 50 people were killed after gunmen attacked a church in Ondo.

104.title: All the rumours about Kartik Aaryan hiking his fee are baseless: Director
104.article_body: A Bollywood director, who is working with Kartik Aaryan on an upcoming project, has refuted the reports claiming that the 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' actor has hiked up his fee. "Kartik is a very grounded guy in reality...All the rumours about him hiking his fee are baseless," the director on the condition of anonymity said. Kartik will next feature in 'Shehzada'.

105.title: Pune NCP protests over reservation in govt jobs for Govindas
105.article_body: The Pune NCP on Monday staged a protest against Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's announcement over reservation in government jobs for Dahi Handi participants. The protesters said this will be an injustice to those preparing for government jobs. Last week, the CM announced that Govindas playing Dahi Handi will be eligible for government jobs under the 5% sports quota.

106.title: Hyderabad Police to increase number of patrolling vehicles
106.article_body: The Hyderabad Police will be increasing the number of patrolling vehicles at Banjara Hills and Jubilee Hills police stations to reduce the emergency response time due to high number of dial 100 calls received from these areas. The police stations having larger jurisdictions have also been allotted extra quota of fuel for patrol vehicles, Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand said.

107.title: K Kavitha to file defamation case after BJP leaders call her AAP-liquor mafia middleman
107.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter and MLC K Kavitha said that she will file defamation case against Delhi BJP leaders Parvesh Verma and Manjinder Singh Sirsa after they said that she acted as a "middleman" between liquor mafia and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government. "I don't have any link...with what was said in...Delhi Excise scam," K Kavitha said.

108.title: Wrong judgement of driver: BJP's Fadnavis on ex-MLC's accident
108.article_body: Days after former MLC Vinayak Mete died in a car crash on Mumbai-Pune Expressway, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that it was an "utterly wrong judgement" of Mete's driver. The 52-year-old Shiv Sangram party leader was killed after his car hit a truck on August 14. Police had said that Mete's driver was trying to overtake a truck.

109.title: BJP offered me CM post if I break AAP: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia
109.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday alleged that BJP offered him the Chief Minister's post if he broke AAP. He claimed that someone came to him with two offers from BJP. Sisodia added that he was told that all big cases registered against him by CBI and ED would be taken back if he quit AAP and joined BJP.

110.title: Radhakishan Damani likely to be main trustee of Jhunjhunwala's estate: Report
110.article_body: DMart's billionaire owner Radhakishan Damani is likely to be the main trustee of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's estate, Moneycontrol reported. Damani is said to have the final say in the main publicly listed investments of Jhunjhunwala. The investor, who passed away last week, reportedly left his assets, including investments in listed and unlisted firms, mainly to his wife and children.

111.title: Sensex plunges over 870 points to close at 58,773, Nifty ends below 17,500
111.article_body: Sensex on Monday plunged by 872 points to close at 58,773, whereas the Nifty was down 267 points to settle below 17,500, marking the second consecutive decline for the benchmark indices. Shares of ITC, Coal India, Tata Consumer Products, Nestle India and Britannia Industries were among top Nifty gainers. Meanwhile, Tata Steel, Asian Paints, Adani Ports were among major losers.

112.title: Chiranjeevi is ageless megastar, has same pace & grace: 'Bholaa...' director
112.article_body: Filmmaker Meher Ramesh has said that directing actor Chiranjeevi in 'Bholaa Shankar' was a dream come true for him. "Chiranjeevi is an ageless megastar...No other actor or star has this kind of stardom even after all these years," he added. "Even now he is acting as a lead actor...he is doing it with the same grace and speed," he stated.

113.title: Rhea shares pics of herself crying on seeing Sonam Kapoor’s newborn
113.article_body: Rhea Kapoor on Monday introduced Instagram to her 'nephew' and Sonam Kapoor-Anand Ahuja's son, who was born on August 20. Rhea shared photos of herself in which she can be seen crying at the sight of her newborn nephew. Calling Sonam "the bravest mommy" and Anand "the most loving dad", Rhea described the moment as "unreal".

114.title: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' goes on floors, Akshay is first guest: Reports
114.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma has reportedly started shooting for the new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', which he announced on Sunday. As per reports, Kapil is shooting the first episode with Akshay Kumar, who will be promoting his upcoming film 'Cuttputlli' on the show. Along with Akshay, the episode will reportedly feature Rakul Preet Singh and Sargun Mehta.

115.title: KCR’s family attended meetings on formulation of Delhi excise policy: BJP MP
115.article_body: BJP MP Parvesh Verma has claimed that Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao's family members attended meetings on the formulation of the Delhi excise policy at a hotel. "KCR's family members got the same policy implemented in Punjab. They prepared a plan for Delhi along with Manish Sisodia and Arvind Kejriwal," Verma added.

116.title: 55-yr-old kills 11-yr-old girl for reporting his misbehaviour in B'luru
116.article_body: A 55-year-old man killed his 11-year-old neighbour, allegedly after she reported his misbehaviour, before stabbing himself to death in Bengaluru on Sunday, police said. The accused had blocked the girl when she was going down the stairs, following which he had been asked to move out, officers said. He stabbed her after failing to find a place for rent.

117.title: KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant could be India's all-format captains in future: Karim
117.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has named KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant as the players who can become India's all-format captain in the future. "For how long Rohit can continue given his injury woes? So, these things also have to be kept in mind," added Karim. Rahul captained India in a Test and three ODIs against South Africa earlier this year.

118.title: 22-year-old Shubman Gill smashes his first-ever hundred in international cricket
118.article_body: Team India opener Shubman Gill on Monday smashed his first-ever hundred in international cricket. The 22-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 82 deliveries against Zimbabwe in the third ODI. Shubman, who made his international debut in an ODI in 2019, took 30 international innings to record his maiden international ton.

119.title: Shubman breaks Rohit's record, becomes youngest Indian to smash a hundred in Zimbabwe
119.article_body: Opener Shubman Gill has become the youngest-ever Indian to smash a hundred in international cricket on Zimbabwean soil. Gill slammed a hundred in the third ODI against Zimbabwe in Harare aged 22 years and 348 days. He broke the record set by Rohit Sharma, who had slammed an ODI ton in Zimbabwe aged 23 years and 28 days.

120.title: I've made sure I'm the one paying for kids' education: Twinkle Khanna
120.article_body: Actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna has said that she has always made sure that she is the one paying for her children's education. "I want them to say that my mother paid for my education and not just fed me aloo parathas," she added. Twinkle further revealed she never had a joint account with her husband and actor Akshay Kumar.

121.title: Garcia becomes first-ever qualifier to win WTA 1000 title at Cincinnati Open
121.article_body: Unseeded Caroline Garcia beat two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova 6-2, 6-4 to win Cincinnati Open title on Sunday and became the first-ever qualifier to win a WTA 1000 title. "Don't know how to describe that week because I came here on Wednesday night to get ready for qualifiers," said Garcia. Garcia beat three top-10 opponents en route to the final.

122.title: B'day wishes to my brother whom I love, respect: Pawan to Chiranjeevi
122.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Pawan Kalyan wished actor Chiranjeevi on his 67th birthday. "My wholehearted birthday wishes to my beloved brother whom I love, respect and adore," he tweeted. "Wishing you good health, success and glory on this special day," he added. Chiranjeevi will next feature in 'GodFather'.

123.title: Paine returns to Tasmania team after break over sexting scandal
123.article_body: Ex-Australian Test captain Tim Paine is reportedly set to make his competitive cricket comeback in the upcoming Sheffield Shield season. Cricket Tasmania CEO Dom Baker has confirmed that Paine has been training with the state squad. Paine had resigned from captaincy and had taken an indefinite break from all cricket amid his 'd**k pic' scandal last year.

124.title: Man kills 33-year-old wife in front of children over dowry in Hyd
124.article_body: A man killed his 33-year-old wife in front of their children in Hyderabad's Uppal district over a dowry dispute. The deceased had lodged a complaint a few years back and the police helped the couple reconcile. The accused, after having fought with his wife over the same issue, killed her in front of their children and escaped.

125.title: 68,000 candidates register for Agniveer rally at Army's Pune office
125.article_body: As many as 68,000 candidates have registered at the Pune office of the Indian Army for the second Agniveer recruitment rally. The rally is being organised at Mahatma Phule Krishi Vidyapeeth at Rahuri in Ahmednagar from August 23 (Tuesday) to September 11. A daily footfall of around 5,000 candidates is expected, Army officials said.

126.title: US is procrastinating talks to revive 2015 nuclear deal: Iran
126.article_body: Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesperson Nasser Kanaani on Monday accused the US of "procrastinating" indirect talks to revive the 2015 nuclear deal and said that there is "inaction" from the European sides. Adding that the agreement is needed more by the US and Europe than Iran, he also stated that Tehran wanted a "sustainable deal that would preserve its legitimate rights".

127.title: Comedian Kapil Sharma makes ramp-walk debut at Beti Fashion Show
127.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma marked his debut on the ramp as he turned showstopper for Anu Ranjan's Beti Fashion Show over the weekend. Kapil was dressed in a black puff-sleeve jacket, which was paired with black pants featuring gold patchwork. A video shared by Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani shows Kapil walking the ramp and also imitating female models at the end.

128.title: 2019 bronze medallist Praneeth crashes out of World Championships 2022
128.article_body: Sai Praneeth crashed out of World Championships 2022 in Tokyo after losing in first round on Monday. The 2019 bronze medallist lost to fourth-seeded Chou Tien Chen 15-21, 21-15, 15-21. In women's doubles, Indian duo of Ashwini Ponnappa and Sikki Reddy entered second round with a 21-7, 21-9 win over Maldives' Aminath Nabeeha Abdul Razzaq and Fathimath Nabaaha Abdul Razzaq.

129.title: Akasa Air operates 2 flights daily between Bengaluru & Mumbai
129.article_body: Newly-launched Akasa Air has started operating flights between Bengaluru and Mumbai twice daily. The budget carrier currently operates from Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Kochi and Mumbai. The first Akasa Air flight operated between Mumbai and Ahmedabad on August 7 this year and it also began operations from Bengaluru to Kochi on August 12.

130.title: SC stays Delhi HC order to file FIR against Shahnawaz Hussain in rape case
130.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday stayed a Delhi High Court order to register a First Information Report (FIR) against BJP leader Syed Shahnawaz Hussain in a 2018 rape complaint. "We are prima facie of the view that the matter requires consideration. We will issue notice and stay all proceedings," a Bench led by Justice UU Lalit said.

131.title: Farmers stopped at Ghazipur border, allowed to proceed after due verification: Police
131.article_body: Some farmers who had gathered for protests in the national capital on Monday were stopped at the Ghazipur border, "in view of the heightened security measures and threat perception", police said. "However, after due verifications, all of them were allowed to proceed to their respective destinations," DCP (East district) Priyanka Kashyap added.

132.title: Euro falls to parity with US dollar for the second time this year
132.article_body: The euro briefly slipped below parity with the US dollar on Monday amid fear regarding recession in the euro zone. The currency was trading at exactly $1 after recovering marginally. This is the second time the euro has hit parity with dollar this year. In July, the euro reached parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years.

133.title: Philippine kids return to schools after 2 yrs as COVID-19 curbs ease
133.article_body: Millions of children returned to classrooms for their first in-person class as all schools were reopened in the Philippines on Monday after two years, as the country eased coronavirus restrictions. In November last year, the country had opened some schools in a pilot project to test in-person classes. Precautions like mandating face masks and temperature checks are in place.

134.title: Vodafone agrees to sell Hungarian unit for $1.8 billion
134.article_body: Britain's Vodafone has agreed to sell its Hungarian business for $1.8 billion in cash as part of its plan to simplify its business. The firm has sold its assets to 4iG Public and state-run Corvinus Zrt. The deal does not include Vodafone's shared services business VOIS and is expected to create Hungary's second largest telecoms operator.

135.title: Mike Tyson punched me by mistake, I had migraine for whole day: Vijay Deverakonda
135.article_body: Talking about boxing legend Mike Tyson who has made a cameo in his upcoming film 'Liger', actor Vijay Deverakonda said Tyson punched him by mistake during rehearsals. "I had migraine for the whole day...I didn’t get knocked out...but body wanted to fall down," he added. "I was worried when I saw his hands, his foot and his neck," he remarked.

136.title: Man shooting video with snake dies after reptile bites him in Uttar Pradesh
136.article_body: A man shooting a video with a snake in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur died after he was allegedly bitten by the reptile. The deceased was reportedly famous in the area for rescuing snakes and had caught more than 200 snakes in the village. The snake with which he was allegedly shooting the video, was caught from his neighbour's house, reports said.

137.title: Mumbai woman mistakenly consumes poison instead of stomach medicine, dies
137.article_body: A 24-year-old woman in Mumbai mistakenly consumed rat poison instead of medicine for stomach ache. She died a week later, police said. The incident took place on August 13 at around 9.30 pm. The deceased had called her mother to tell her that she was vomiting after consuming poison and that she needed help. She was taken to the hospital.

138.title: 'Hera Pheri' producer Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala passes away aged 91
138.article_body: Veteran producer Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala, who produced films like 'Hera Pheri' and 'Lahoo Ke Do Rang', passed away aged 91. He reportedly died due to cardiac arrest while being treated at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai. Mourning his demise, actor Ajay Devgn tweeted, "Deepest condolences...My father and he were associates during the golden era of our cinema."

139.title: I guess I was too relaxed to lose, it cost me: Tsitsipas on Cincinnati Open final
139.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas has said he was "too relaxed" against Borna Coric in the final of the Cincinnati Open. "Coric was obviously the opposite of what I was...Sometimes it makes you not be that much present in the moment when you're too relaxed. It takes away that momentum that you are trying to capture," added Tsitsipas.

140.title: Sanjay Raut’s custody extended till September 5 in land scam case
140.article_body: A special Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court extended the judicial custody of Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut till September 5 in the Patra Chawl land scam case. The Enforcement Directorate stated that releasing Raut at this time will hamper the investigation since he has great influence and it is possible that he will tamper with the evidence.

141.title: Ford ordered to pay $1.7 billion over pickup truck crash that killed US couple
141.article_body: A jury has ordered Ford Motor to pay $1.7 billion after a US couple was killed in a pickup truck crash in 2014. The couple died after a tyre blew out on a local highway and their 2002 Ford Super Duty F-250 pickup rolled over. Following the crash, the couple's children sued Ford alleging the pickup had a weak roof.

142.title: We're working on the script: Jennifer Grey on 'Dirty Dancing' sequel
142.article_body: Actress Jennifer Grey, speaking about the 'Dirty Dancing' sequel said, "I can't tell you much...but I'll tell you that it will involve Baby (her character in the film)." She further added that they are working on the script for the sequel. She added, "We're going to shoot it in the spring of 2023...it comes out on February 9, 2024."

143.title: 5-km-long jam at Delhi-Noida border due to police checking; pics surface
143.article_body: A five-kilometre-long traffic jam was seen at Noida-Delhi Link Road at Chilla Border amid checking of vehicles by police personnel in wake of farmers' protests in the national capital today. Huge traffic snarls were also reported on Delhi-Meerut Expressway, NH-9 and DND flyway. Delhi Traffic Police said that they have deployed additional traffic personnel to handle the situation.

144.title: Slaves of Gujarat: KTR shares video of BJP leader fetching Amit Shah's sandals
144.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao shared a video in which Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar is seen fetching sandals of Union Home Minister Amit Shah when the latter visited a temple in the state. Reacting to it, Rao said that the people of Telangana are watching the "slaves of Gujarat" and will reverse any attempt to denigrate Telangana's "self-respect".

145.title: Priyanka Gandhi should campaign across India: Hanumantha Rao
145.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao said that party's General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra should campaign across the country and not only stick to Uttar Pradesh. "If Rahul Gandhi is not available, she should also visit south India to strengthen the party at the ground level," said Rao. He further added that Priyanka should contest from Medak constituency like her grandmother.

146.title: GHMC likely to convert Sardar Mahal into a museum: Reports
146.article_body: According to reports, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) will convert Sardar Mahal into a museum which will display the history of the area. The GHMC is scheduled to meet on August 29 where it is likely to give a nod to the proposal. It is located near Charminar and is one of the historical monuments in Hyderabad.

147.title: 16 trauma care centres set up in Hyderabad
147.article_body: Telangana government has set up 16 trauma care centres and 10 advance life support ambulances on the Outer Ring Road of Hyderabad. Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao appealed to people to spread the word about the life-saving trauma care facility. The government also issued new toll-free numbers (1066/1059102) which can be used during any emergency.

148.title: Man rapes & murders 8-yr-old in Delhi, dumps her body in Yamuna
148.article_body: A 36-year-old butcher has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly kidnapping an 8-year-old girl while she was sleeping at her house, raping her, slitting her throat and dumping her body in the Yamuna. The post-mortem revealed that the accused also disfigured the victim's face using a sharp weapon to destroy her identity. The victim's parents work as labourers.

149.title: Tesla's Autopilot averts 40 crashes/day caused by sudden acceleration: Exec
149.article_body: Tesla's Autopilot Software Director Ashok Elluswamy has said that the firm's Autopilot prevents around 40 crashes per day that would have been caused by sudden unintended acceleration (SUA). He shared instances where drivers misapplied the pedals and were saved by Autopilot. He even shared a video in which he claims the Autopilot saved a man's legs from getting injured.

150.title: 4 members of family killed after car falls into gorge in Himachal
150.article_body: Four members of a family were killed after their car skidded off the road and fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba on Sunday. The victims were identified as Chamba head post office's postal superintendent Tilak Raj, his wife and teenage children. Villagers said they heard a bang and rushed to the spot but the victims had already passed.

151.title: Islamic State suicide bomber plotting to attack Indian leader detained in Russia
151.article_body: The Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) has said that its officers have detained a suicide bomber, a member of the Islamic State terrorist group, who was plotting an attack in India. Russia said that he "planned to commit a terrorist act by blowing himself up against one of the representatives of the ruling circles of India".

152.title: Thankless task: Russian minister on speculating strategic talks with US
152.article_body: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergey Ryabkov has said that the possibility of the resumption of strategic talks with US "is far from obvious" given the "recklessly aggressive" policy that Washington is pursuing towards Moscow. Moreover, he added that speculating about prospects for strategic dialogue with US, "especially in the conditions when the Americans broke it off, is a thankless task."

153.title: Sajad Lone warns of hunger strike over voting rights to outsiders in J&K
153.article_body: J&K People’s Conference President Sajad Lone commented on the matter of inclusion of outsiders in J&K electoral rolls. "If we feel there is demographic intervention or the rights of the people of J&K are compromised, then we will sit on hunger strike in front of Parliament in Delhi," Lone said. "We're scared of those implementing the law," he added.

154.title: Farooq Abdullah holds all-party meet over 'inclusion of non-local voters' in J&K
154.article_body: National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah on Monday held an all-party meeting regarding the "inclusion of non-locals as voters" in J&K at his residence in Srinagar. Meanwhile, J&K People's Conference President Sajad Lone opted out of the meeting. "If this effort (all party meeting) was serious, it would not be held under media gaze," Lone said.

155.title: Attack on Salman Rushdie designed to create regime of fear: IMSD
155.article_body: The Indian Muslims for Secular Democracy (IMSD) condemned the attack on 'The Satanic Verses' writer Salman Rushdie and questioned the silence of Muslim organisations. IMSD said in a statement that the attack was designed to create a regime of fear. It added that the silence of Muslims emboldens "Islamophobes to paint the religion as a creed of violence and terror".

156.title: Video shows mob climbing building to catch Hindu man over fake blasphemy case in Pak
156.article_body: A Hindu man in Pakistan was booked in a fake blasphemy case over alleged desecration of Quran, reports said. A video shows hundreds of people around an apartment building and some climbing the building to get hold of Ashok Kumar. The video shows police dispersing the mob by lathicharging. Reports added that a Muslim woman had actually burned the Quran.

157.title: No place for Manish Sisodia in BJP: Parvesh Verma
157.article_body: Delhi BJP MP Parvesh Verma reacted to Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's claim that the BJP had offered to "shut all cases" against him if he quit AAP and crossed over. "Sisodia is not welcomed in BJP and he has no place here," Verma said. Not only BJP but no other party should allow Sisodia to join them, he added.

158.title: FTX's revenue jumped by more than 1,000% in a year, leaked documents show
158.article_body: The revenue of privately held crypto exchange FTX surged more than 1,000% from $89 million in 2020 to $1.02 billion in 2021, according to leaked internal documents. Further, its operating income was $272 million in 2021, up from $14 million a year earlier. FTX saw net income of $388 million last year, up from just $17 million a year earlier.

159.title: Musk lists main goals for Tesla & SpaceX for 2022, says 'will require insane work'
159.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk took to Twitter on Monday to share his two main goals for this year. He said that sending SpaceX's Starship rocket to the Earth's orbit and a wide release of Tesla's full-self driving software are the "two giant kahunas". Musk further noted that the goals will require "insane work by many super talented people".

160.title: It's in his own hands: Shahid Afridi on Kohli's future ahead of Asia Cup
160.article_body: During a question-answer session on Twitter, ex-Pakistan skipper Shahid Afridi was asked about Virat Kohli's future. "It's in his own hands," replied Afridi. The former all-rounder was also asked about his views on Kohli's century drought in international cricket since 2019. "Only tough times can unearth big players," said Afridi. Kohli will return to competitive cricket at the Asia Cup.

161.title: 3 policemen kneel on man & repeatedly kick, punch his face in US; suspended
161.article_body: Three police officers have been suspended in US' Arkansas after a video showing them beating up an alleged suspect went viral. The video shows the officers kneeling on him before punching his face and kicking him repeatedly. One of the officers was also seen slamming his head onto the ground. According to police, the man had assaulted an officer first.

162.title: Massive setback for Pakistan: Inzamam on Shaheen getting ruled out of Asia Cup
162.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq has said that pacer Shaheen Afridi's absence from Asia Cup is a "massive setback" for the Babar Azam-led side. "If you look at the last match against India, Shaheen created pressure right from the very first over," added Inzamam. Shaheen had dismissed KL Rahul, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in their T20 World Cup match last year.

163.title: Teen who was pursuing rape case found dead in canal in UP
163.article_body: The body of a 17-year-old girl was recovered in a canal in UP's Barabanki district on Saturday after she went missing on August 18. The victim told her parents that she is going to meet her lawyer to discuss a rape case she lodged in January. Police suspect she died by suicide and her body has been sent for postmortem.

164.title: SC terminates CoA set up to manage All India Football Federation
164.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has dissolved the Committee of Administrators (CoA) that was set up to manage All India Football Federation (AIFF). The SC said it is passing the order to facilitate revocation of suspension of AIFF by FIFA and holding of Under-17 FIFA World Cup in India as well as allowing participation of teams from India in international events.

165.title: Allu Arjun & Rashmika Mandanna-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rule' goes on floors
165.article_body: The shooting of Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rule' began on Monday. Taking to Instagram, the makers of the film said that they will hold a pooja ceremony on Monday and added, "Pushpa Raj is back! This time to Rule." The film also features Rashmika Mandanna and Fahadh Faasil. The sequel to the 2021 film will be directed by Sukumar.

166.title: Bumped into each other in lift, was lovely meeting him: Papon on Mohanlal
166.article_body: Singer Papon has said that it was "lovely meeting" actor Mohanlal and called him "a great and humble artist". He added, "We bumped [into] each other in the lift...he came to my room and I hosted him with a warm welcome in my state." Speaking about meeting Mohanlal, Papon further said that it felt like meeting an elder brother.

167.title: Railways to ply 6 Ganpati special trains between Mumbai and Mangaluru
167.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) announced that it will run six additional Ganpati special trains between Lokmanya Tilak Terminus and Mangaluru Junction to manage the rush of passengers during the festive season. Earlier, the Central Railway announced running of 212 Ganpati specials. With the introduction of six additional trains, the total number of Ganpati specials this year will be 218.

168.title: MSP is not being implemented because PM has a friend whose name is Adani: Satya Pal Malik
168.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik on Sunday said, "The MSP is not being implemented because Prime Minister has a friend whose name is Adani, who at the moment has become Asia's richest person in five years." He added, "You cannot defeat the farmer. You cannot scare him...since you cannot send ED or Income-Tax officers, how will you scare the farmer?"

169.title: Pak army truck plunges into ravine in PoK; 9 killed, 4 injured
169.article_body: At least nine Pakistani soldiers were killed and four others injured after an army truck they were travelling in plunged into a ravine in Shaujabad area in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) on Sunday. According to the Pakistan army's media wing Inter-Services Public Relations, the incident occurred during routine military duty, Geo TV reported. The injured soldiers were taken to a hospital.

170.title: IMD issues red alert for heavy rainfall in 39 districts of Madhya Pradesh
170.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued red alert for heavy rainfall in 39 districts of Madhya Pradesh. Red alert has been issued in districts including Bhopal, Ujjain, Jabalpur, Ratlam, Neemuch and Mandsaur. Moderate rainfall has also been predicted in 12 districts including Indore, Gwalior, Dhar and Khargone. Schools in Narmadapuram and Bhopal have been shut in view of heavy rains.

171.title: Switzerland's Credit Suisse appoints Dixit Joshi as Chief Financial Officer
171.article_body: Switzerland's second-biggest bank Credit Suisse on Monday announced the appointment of Dixit Joshi as its new Chief Financial Officer. Joshi will take over on October 1, replacing David Mathers who previously announced he is stepping down. Joshi joins Credit Suisse from Deutsche Bank after nearly 12 years. He served as the German bank's Group Treasurer in his last role.

172.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd ODI against Zimbabwe
172.article_body: Team India captain KL Rahul won the toss for the third time in the row and elected to bat first against Zimbabwe in the third ODI in Harare. India have made two changes to their playing XI with Deepak Chahar and Avesh Khan replacing Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna. Zimbabwe have also made two changes to their playing XI.

173.title: Disha Patani is still among few I'd call if I need help: Krishna Shroff
173.article_body: Tiger Shroff's sister Krishna Shroff has said that actress Disha Patani is "one of the first few people" she would call if she needed help. "I know she'd be there. In a world, where women are constantly pulling each other down, she and I are the opposite," she added. This comes after Disha and Tiger reportedly ended their relationship.

174.title: Stardom is just a by-product: Pranay on Kareena's OTT actors remark
174.article_body: Speaking about actress Kareena Kapoor's OTT actors remark, actor Pranay Singh Pachauri stated that stardom is just the by-product of acting. Kareena had said that OTT actors have shown stars their standing. "Whatever Kareena ma'am has seen, none of us have even touched it. It takes a lot of courage and being down to earth to...say that," the actor added.

175.title: Big Tech's India executives to depose before Parliamentary panel
175.article_body: The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Finance has asked Indian executives of tech giants like Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, Google and Netflix to testify on Tuesday. The meeting will address the 'anti-competitive practices by big tech companies', a notice by the Lok Sabha Secretariat said. Tech giants are facing a probe by the Competition Commission of India over alleged anti-competitive practices.

176.title: Landslide hits Shi'ite Muslim shrine in Iraq; 4 dead, 6 rescued
