This is a part of a relay Long Range Patrol ‘Amrit’ that started on August 1 and will end on October 14 after completing a 75-day journey covering a distance of approximately 7,575 km.

350.title: Deep depression weakens, rainfall likely in MP, Chhattisgarh: IMD
350.article_body: The deep depression over northwest Chhattisgarh, adjoining Madhya Pradesh and southeast UP has weakened into a depression. The India Meteorological Department claimed that the depression will continue to move west-northwestwards across north MP and weakens into a low-pressure area in 24 hours. However, IMD predicted that heavy rainfall at most places will continue over the respective areas.

351.title: Pune man held for killing wife, infant after decomposing bodies found in well
351.article_body: Days after decomposing bodies of a 22-year-old woman and her infant child were found in a well in Shirur taluka of Pune, police have arrested the woman's husband for murdering them. The bodies were found on August 8. Officials said that the husband pushed the woman and the child into the well following domestic issues.

352.title: 4 more grain ships leave Ukraine, brings total number to 31
352.article_body: The Turkish Defence Ministry said on Sunday that four more ships carrying grain have left Ukraine's ports. This brings the total number of ships that have left Ukraine under the UN-brokered grain export deal to 31. "In addition, one ship from Ukraine and five ships that will go to Ukraine will be inspected today," the ministry added.

353.title: Japan's Lixil Corporation eyes ₹1,000 cr sales in India in 3 years
353.article_body: Japan-based housing equipment company Lixil Corporation is aiming ₹1,000 crore worth of sales in India in the next three years, a Lixil official said. Bobby Joseph, India and Subcontinent leader told PTI that the capacity of its Vijayawada ceramic plant could be doubled to two million units. Lixil is working on a long-term strategy for the Indian market, Joseph added.

354.title: Mizoram CM issues public apology after video showed daughter hitting doctor
354.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga issued a public apology after a video of his daughter Milari Chhangte assaulting a doctor went viral. Milari was reportedly upset after the doctor refused to see her without an appointment. In a handwritten note, the CM apologised for his daughter's "misbehaviour". The Mizoram unit of IMA also wore black badges to work over this incident.

355.title: Manish Sisodia is 'Liquor Minister’: BJP's Adesh Gupta
355.article_body: Reacting to the alleged liquor scam, Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta called Deputy CM Manish Sisodia "Liquor Minister". He alleged that the excise policy of the Delhi government was sinful, corrupt and tyrannical. "It is seen for the first time in independent India that the Education Minister is the Liquor Minister,” Adesh Gupta said.

356.title: Man hides spy camera in charger, blackmails B'luru woman with private videos
356.article_body: Bengaluru City Police arrested a 30-year-old man, who allegedly blackmailed his woman friend into having a physical relationship with him by capturing her private videos using a spy camera, officers said on Saturday. The accused recorded videos of the woman changing her clothes, police said. He used the videos to demand a physical relationship from the woman, the investigation revealed.

357.title: Kejriwal model failed, corruption reached its peak in Delhi: Union Minister
357.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Sunday said that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal’s model has failed in the national capital. "Corruption has reached its peak," Thakur added. "The taking back of excise policy in Delhi after CBI's raid proves corruption has happened...Kingpin Arvind Kejriwal will have to answer for this," Thakur stated.

358.title: Security increased in Delhi ahead of farmers' protest at Jantar Mantar
358.article_body: Delhi Police put up cemented barricades and tightened security at the Delhi-Haryana's Tikri border ahead of a protest called by farmers at Jantar Mantar on Monday. The farmers are planning to stage a protest against unemployment and other issues in the country. Farmer leader Rakesh Tikait was detained while he was entering Delhi to take part in the protest.

359.title: NZ to temporarily boost foreign worker intake, alter immigration rules
359.article_body: New Zealand will make temporary changes to its immigration rules to hire thousands of extra workers amid a labour shortage, Immigration Minister Michael Wood said on Sunday. The country will revise its Working Holiday Visa scheme with the aim to attract 12,000 foreign workers. "These measures are about providing immediate relief to...businesses hardest hit by...global worker shortage," Wood said.

360.title: Vijay Shekhar Sharma's reappointment as Paytm MD & CEO gets shareholders' nod
360.article_body: The reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as Paytm's MD and CEO for a five-year period has been approved by its shareholders. A total of 99.67% shareholders voted in favour of Sharma's reappointment, Paytm's parent company said. The shareholders further approved a resolution to fix Sharma's remuneration for the next three years without any annual increment, with 94.48% votes in favour.

361.title: Slept for 10 hrs after shooting Shehzada's climax scene: Kartik
361.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram to share a picture from the sets of 'Shehzada' and said that he slept for 10 hours after filming the "epic climax" of the upcoming movie. "One of the most difficult, hectic and again a new zone for me," he added. The film, being directed by Rohit Dhawan, will also star Kriti Sanon.

362.title: Kapil confirms new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', drops his new look
362.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma on Sunday shared his new look and announced that he will soon return to the television screens with the new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' (TKSS). The show went on hiatus after Kapil and his team went on a tour to USA and Canada, and Australia. The new season will reportedly air from September onwards.

363.title: Pakistan would've taken 50 overs to chase Zimbabwe's 161 runs: Danish Kaneria
363.article_body: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria has said despite losing wickets at regular intervals during their chase of Zimbabwe's 162-run target, India had an attacking approach. "Many Pakistani fans have said that India lost five wickets while chasing 162...[but] they finished the game within 25 overs. In a similar situation, Pakistan would have taken 50 overs to chase it down," stated Kaneria.

364.title: Police arrest 3 attempting ATM theft in Pune's Nigdi
364.article_body: Three people were arrested by Pimpri-Chinchwad police for attempting to break into an ATM in Nigdi. The accused, identified as Rajendra Popat Bade, Krishna Rajput and Shashank Ghodeswar, were under the influence of alcohol when they attempted the robbery, said Assistant Police inspector S Karode. The accused, he added, were labourers who did not know how to operate an ATM.

365.title: Pune city reports a decline in COVID-19 testing numbers
365.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) limits reported a decline in COVID-19 testing samples. The PMC collected 24,162 samples in August and 12,848 samples in July, which is less compared to previous months. Dr Ashish Bharti, chief, PMC health department, said, "Following a drop in COVID-19 cases and the festive season, many patients are not keen on getting tested."

366.title: No guilt or remorse: Bilkis Bano's lawyer after release of 11 rapists
366.article_body: Bilkis Bano's lawyer Shobha Gupta, while commenting on the release of the 11 convicts, who were sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bano, said there was no guilt or remorse. "Honestly, I don't believe it [remission of 11 convicts] can be treated as a precedent for other rapists and murderers in jail," Gupta said.

367.title: Gotabaya can return to Sri Lanka but must face action: Oppn party
367.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition party Samagi Jana Balawegaya said that while ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa can return to Sri Lanka, he must be tried for allegations of misuse of funds as he doesn't enjoy legal immunity. The party's remarks came as Rajapaksa's cousin said that the ex-leader will return to country soon. Rajapaksa, however, has reportedly applied for a US Green Card.

368.title: No regrets about it: Neha Kakkar on being trolled for crying on TV
368.article_body: Singer Neha Kakkar, speaking about being trolled for crying in reality shows, has said, "We don't see too many people who can feel others' pain and who want to help them." She added, "I have that quality in me and I have no regrets about it." The singer is set to judge the upcoming reality show 'Indian Idol 13'.

369.title: If someone thinks I can change team in a day, then we're living in fool's kingdom: Shakib
369.article_body: Bangladesh T20I captain Shakib Al Hasan has said he has "no goals" for the team ahead of the Asia Cup. "My only aim is we can do well in the T20 WC...If someone thinks I can change things within one or two days...then we're living in a fool's kingdom," stated Shakib. "We've...to make a new start in T20Is," he added.

370.title: Japanese PM Kishida tests positive for COVID-19, recuperating
370.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida tested positive for coronavirus on Sunday, a Cabinet spokesperson said. Kishida took a PCR test after he developed a cough and fever on Saturday, the Cabinet spokesperson added. The PM's office said that Kishida, who'd just returned from a week-long vacation, is currently recuperating at his official residence. Japan recorded 2,53,248 new coronavirus cases on Saturday.

371.title: Kuldeep seemed confused if he should bowl fast or slow vs Zimbabwe: Kaif
371.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has said spinner Kuldeep Yadav seemed confused about the speed at which he should bowl in the second ODI against Zimbabwe. "However, the rhythm is being seen. He bowled well in WI. He'll get better when he plays more matches," added Kaif. Kuldeep registered figures of 1/49 in his eight overs in the second ODI.

372.title: People have started saying it's 'paap' not AAP: BJP's Gaurav Bhatia
372.article_body: Criticising the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia on Sunday said that the people have started saying it’s not AAP, it’s "paap" (sin). "The people of the country are saying that if there is any big corrupt...it is Manish Sisodia and AAP," Bhatia added. His remark came after CBI raided Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia’s residence on Friday.

373.title: Man hacked to death near his house in Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta
373.article_body: A man identified as 25-year-old Abu Bakr Al-Amoodi was reportedly hacked to death near his residence in Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta during the early hours of Sunday. Amoodi was spotted lying in a pool of blood by locals who informed the police. Police recovered a dagger from the crime scene. An individual named Abdul Rahman has been identified as the suspected killer.

374.title: No errors in treatment given to Jayalalithaa at Apollo: AIIMS panel
374.article_body: A report by the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has given clean chit to Apollo hospital where former Tamil Nadu CM Jayalalithaa was admitted before her demise. The medical panel of AIIMS said that the treatment provided to Jayalalithaa was as per “correct medical practice" and no errors have been found in the procedure.

375.title: Rakesh Tikait detained ahead of farmers' protest at Jantar Mantar
375.article_body: Delhi Police detained farmer leader Rakesh Tikait while he was on his way to Jantar Mantar to participate in a protest against unemployment. Tikait was stopped by the police at Ghazipur. After the arrest, Tikait tweeted, "Delhi Police working at the behest of the government cannot suppress the voice of the farmers. This arrest will bring a new revolution."

376.title: Restoration of Peshwa structure in Pune nears completion after 18 yrs
376.article_body: The Vishrambaug Wada, which is one of the last structures built by Peshwas in Pune, will finally be fully open to public as restoration works are expected to conclude soon. The works, which began in 2003, cost the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) ₹8 crore. "Restoration has to be done with patience and taking care of minutest details," an official said.

377.title: Shefali Shah tests negative for COVID-19
377.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has informed her fans that she has tested negative for COVID-19. "I'm absolutely fine, and can resume work now," she wrote in a note, which she shared on Instagram. She thanked the doctors and her fans for their "prayers, concern and love". She asked fans to stay safe and take care of themselves.

378.title: Tiger Shroff's 'Screw Dheela' put on hold due to high budget: Report
378.article_body: Tiger Shroff's upcoming film 'Screw Dheela' has reportedly been put on hold due to budget issues and average response to the film's announcement video. "Screw Dheela is not shelved. The team hopes to visit this film later when the box office environment is conducive," a source quoted by Bollywood Hungama said. Filmmaker Shashank Khaitan is attached to direct the film.

379.title: Saba criticises KL Rahul's decision to bowl first in 2nd ODI vs Zimbabwe
379.article_body: Saba Karim criticised India captain KL Rahul's decision to bowl first in India's five-wicket win against Zimbabwe in second ODI, saying he was expecting India to bat first. "They again took the logical kind of route," he added. "The reason why we were out of...T20 World Cup [2021] was because of our conservative approach while batting first," he further said.

380.title: Some noticed cracks, decided to vacate: Ex- corporator on Mumbai building
380.article_body: An ex-corporator, while talking about the four-storey building that fell in Mumbai's Borivali recently, said that some families noticed cracks in the building and decided to vacate the flats. "So there wasn't anyone inside when the incident occurred," the ex-corporator said. Fire engines and fire brigade officials had rushed to the spot after the building had collapsed.

381.title: Sixth accused arrested for stripping girl in UP
381.article_body: The sixth perpetrator involved in UP’s Hamirpur incident, where a girl was stripped and assaulted by a group of men, was arrested. All accused, including two minors, were arrested based on the incident’s video, which went viral on social media. The woman was assaulted after she was allegedly caught with a man in a forest near the culprits’ village.

382.title: PMC announces competition to improve roads for safe commute to school
382.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has planned to implement innovative methods to enable students to commute independently to and from school by making roads safer for them to walk and cycle on, as well as reducing traffic congestion. PMC has announced a competition for urban designers to find 'implementable ideas'. The civic body has reportedly allotted ₹1 crore for the initiative.

383.title: Only trying to harm B'wood: Taapsee on KRK's tweet on Dobaaraa's collection
383.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has reacted to Kamaal R Khan's tweet over the box office collection of 'Dobaaraa'. She retweeted Hansal Mehta's tweet where he shared a screenshot of KRK's tweet and wrote Bollywood "created these monsters by sucking up to them". Reacting to it, Taapsee wrote, "These people who have relevance...because of the films, are...trying to harm the industry."

384.title: David Warner returns to BBL after 9 years, says 'My girls want me to play at home'
384.article_body: Australian cricketer David Warner has signed a two-year deal with Sydney Thunder, marking his return to the Big Bash League (BBL) after nine years. "My girls have told me...they'd love to watch me play at home and in the BBL," he said. "It will be great for us to be a part of the BBL as a family," Warner stated.

385.title: Blinkit starts printouts delivery at ₹9 per page, Twitter users react
385.article_body: Zomato-owned Blinkit has started a printout delivery service in Gurugram, charging ₹9 per page for black and white printing and ₹19 for coloured with an additional charge of ₹25 on each such order. Reacting to this, a Twitter user wrote, "My local xerox shop owner does it at ₹1/page." Another also wrote, "I’ll get a printer at home."

386.title: Nitish enjoys 'immense goodwill', 'strong candidate' for PM: Tejashwi
386.article_body: Amid reports that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar could emerge as a PM candidate, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday said that Kumar is a "strong candidate" for the post as he enjoys "immense goodwill". Kumar has over 37 years of vast parliamentary and administrative experience, plus he enjoys immense goodwill among his peers, Tejashwi said.

387.title: What did rebel Sena MLAs get by backstabbing us?: Aaditya Thackeray
387.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday asked what the rebel party MLAs got by "backstabbing" the party leadership when it supported them in every possible way. Thackeray on Wednesday claimed that "trapped" legislators in the CM Eknath Shinde-led faction of the party were contacting supporters of Uddhav Thackeray, after the expansion of the Maharashtra cabinet.

388.title: British woman left with 'plastic' forehead after falling asleep in sun for 30 minutes
388.article_body: A 25-year-old British woman named Sirin Murad woke up to find her forehead looking like plastic after falling asleep for 30 minutes in the sun at Sunny Beach in Bulgaria. "No matter how much you think that you’ll be fine or that your skin will not burn, always apply sunscreen!" she said. The temperature at the beach was around 21°C.

389.title: Teacher fired over her cat's appearance in online class wins ₹4.6 lakh payout in China
389.article_body: A teacher who was fired after her cat appeared during an online class has won 40,000 yuan (over ₹4.6 lakh) in an unfair dismissal case in China. The art teacher was conducting an online class last year when her cat jumped into the camera's view five times. The edtech company fired her citing the cat's sudden appearances as a reason.

390.title: I feel embarrassed by it: Vijay Deverakonda on being called superstar
390.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda has said that he always wanted to be called a superstar in the film industry. However, he added, "It has suddenly started feeling a little awkward to me, I am feeling embarrassed by it. Maybe at some point...I don't think I have done enough to deserve it yet." The actor will next feature in 'Liger'.

391.title: Kids who were born after its release are loving it: Vatsal on 'Taarzan...'
391.article_body: Actor Vatsal Sheth has said that his film 'Taarzan: The Wonder Car', which was released in 2004, was way ahead of its time. "Kids who were born recently are watching it and loving it. This is a great quality of the film," he added. Vatsal further said 'Taarzan: The Wonder Car' is the "number one film on television".

392.title: Japan considers deploying 1,000 missiles to counter China: Report
392.article_body: Japan is considering the deployment of 1,000 long-range cruise missiles to increase its capacity to counter an attack from China, the Japanese newspaper Yomiuri reported. The missiles would be capable of reaching North Korea and China's coastal areas, it said. In July, Japan had identified China, Russia and North Korea as its main security concerns in a defence white paper.

393.title: Air India starts more flights on Mumbai-Bengaluru route
393.article_body: Air India has started operating additional flights between Mumbai and Bengaluru. With this, the total number of flights running between the two metro cities has increased to four. Air India had announced 24 additional domestic flights starting August 20 and the new flights between the two metros are part of it.

394.title: Need to eradicate caste system, adopt zero tolerance for prejudice: Meira Kumar
394.article_body: Former Lok Sabha Speaker Meira Kumar said the caste system needs to be eradicated and stressed on adopting "zero tolerance" for prejudice. Her statement comes after a nine-year-old Dalit boy was allegedly beaten to death by his teacher in Rajasthan’s Jalore. "Caste system is an illness. Atrocities related to caste often lead to crippling of the soul," Kumar added.

395.title: Freebies are never free; inform voters of its impact: RBI MPC member
395.article_body: Freebies are never free and political parties offering such schemes must be required to make the financing and trade-offs clear to voters, RBI Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) member Ashima Goyal said. This would reduce the temptation towards "competitive populism", she added. Freebies come at the cost of low quality health, education, air and water that hurt poor, she further added.

396.title: Outgoing Meta COO Sheryl marries businessman Tom Bernthal, shares pic
396.article_body: Outgoing Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg tied the knot with businessman Tom Bernthal and shared their picture on Instagram. Sharing the same photo, Bernthal wrote, "After both experiencing losses, Sheryl and I weren't sure we would ever find love again. Over the last three years, we've merged our lives and blended our families. Our wedding...was a dream come true."

397.title: World no. 28 Kvitova reaches 40th career singles final at Cincinnati Open
397.article_body: World number 28 Petra Kvitova entered her first final at Cincinnati Open after beating 2019 champion Madison Keys 6-7(6-8), 6-4, 6-3 in the semi-final on Saturday. Overall, this is Kvitova's 40th career singles final. Kvitova will face unseeded Caroline Garcia, the first-ever qualifier to reach the final of a WTA 1000 tournament. Garcia defeated sixth-seeded Aryna Sabalenka 6-2, 4-6, 6-1.

398.title: Crawley still learning his game, I believe in him: Brendon McCullum
398.article_body: England's Test team head coach Brendon McCullum has said their opener Zak Crawley, who hasn't crossed the fifty-run mark in his last 14 Test innings, is a talented batter who's still learning. "Crawley is still learning his game at this level. That'll take some patience and persistence," stated McCullum. The 24-year-old scored 22 runs in the first South Africa Test.

399.title: Houses, roads damaged; working to bring back normalcy: U'khand CM Dhami
399.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said many houses, roads and bridges have been damaged amid heavy rainfall in the state. "Many people are injured and missing. Our priority is to make sure medical aid reaches injured persons; search & rescue operations are underway...There has been a lot of damage to infrastructure. We're working to bring back normalcy," he added.

400.title: Truck hits crowd, cars at accident site in Turkey; 20 killed
400.article_body: At least 20 people were killed after a truck crashed into two cars and ploughed through emergency responders and a crowd gathered at an accident site in Turkey's Mardin on Saturday, according to Turkish Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu. He added that 26 people were injured. This is the second such accident to take place in Turkey on the same day.

401.title: Gurugram couple booked for cheating woman of ₹3.75 cr in bogus land deal
401.article_body: A husband and wife were booked for allegedly cheating a woman of ₹3.75 crore on the pretext of a land deal, which turned out to be bogus, in Gurugram's Manesar. The victim, Sunita Yadav, alleged that the accused, Sandeep Yadav and Manju Rani, had sold her an already mortgaged plot. Sunita alleged that her husband died because of getting cheated.

402.title: Whole thing of two actresses having jealousy is b******t: Shefali Shah
402.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has said, "I take immense pride in working with all the women I have worked with till now." "This whole thing of two actresses fighting or having jealousy is b******t," she added. Shefali recently shared screen space with Vidya Balan in 'Jalsa' and Alia Bhatt in 'Darlings'. Shefali will next feature in season two of 'Delhi Crime'.
